parameters:
--What the! This is our bandits' home! Don't just barge in
here, you little girl!

Damn it--! Those damn kunoichi...! If it weren't for them, I
could have kept embracing women in Sunuramu Village
forever...

Hmm? Haven't I seen you somewhere before...? Weren't you in
the bandit fortress's prison...?

No, no! I'm just a tourist! Ahaha--! (I need to get out of
here before my cover is blown...!)
Ugh... Even so... I'm so hungry...

(It seems this old man is also hungry... Let's both do our
best to survive...)

Hello... Excuse me for intruding. Is this the home of the
white-haired monk...?

...? Huh? Have we met before? I think this is my first time
here...

Grrr! Forgetful girl! Didn't you recognize me because your
hair has grown and you've gotten tanned?
(This way of speaking...? ...Hmm? Could it be...)

It's because of you that I was banished to this remote
island! Just when my cult was doing well and the number of
followers was increasing...!

Hmph! Remember now with these black glasses on? It's me.
Kokuyou Tengu!
Ah! Kokuyou Tengu! To think we'd meet in a place like this!

After you beat me up, I was taken to the magistrate's
office... The followers who were under my spell complained
bitterly, and I was convicted of a serious crime,
mercilessly exiled to this desolate island. It's too much to
bear. Alas...

Ugh! But that's what you get for your own actions, right?
It's misguided to blame me!

What crime did you commit to be exiled to this island? Did
you do something terrible?
...I won't tell. It's a secret, a secret--

Hmm. You're stingy. How has life been since you were cast
away on this island? Are you able to get by with food?

Kachou-san and Kisanosuke-san have been kind to me. I've
learned how to fish, so I feel less hungry these days.

Those two are quite good people. Uncharacteristic for this
island...
Right. They both said they want to return to Edo as well...

...What? Why are you staring? Planning to cast some
suspicious hypnosis again? I won't meet your eyes, just so
you know...!

I've sealed away the hypnosis. You told me not to use it on
humans. Since then, I haven't used it on anyone.

Hmm. Really? But if you were still using your powers, you
wouldn't have been exiled here... You're surprisingly
conscientious.

Karin. I have an important question... Just between us,
don't you want to escape from this desolate island?

Eh!? Well, if possible... I left without telling anything to
Oei-san, she must be worried about me disappearing...

Hmm. In that case, I have some valuable information. I could
share it with you.
...!? Valuable information? To escape from this island?

Indeed. But I won't tell you for free. Bring me [Sea Bream].
Then I shall tell you.
What? You could just tell me now, couldn't you?

Hmph! Don't be foolish. It's because of you that I'm living
such an inconvenient life! This is my revenge, my revenge!
Bring me four sea breams! Then I'll share the valuable
information!

...Alright, Kokuyou Tengu. I'll bring you four sea breams.
Wait until then.

Sorry to keep you waiting. Look, I've caught the sea breams!
Just as you requested, I've brought exactly four of them.

Oh! You've done well to bring them! Good job! I'll have them
right away! One can't fight on an empty stomach!
--Karin handed over the four sea breams to Kokuyou Tengu.

Ah... Delicious! It warms the body and it's simply the best!
Humans really do need to eat to feel energetic! I can feel
my strength and spirit surging back

...(Wow, he's really going at it... He must have been very
hungry.)

Hey, what's wrong, Karin? I've also made some sea bream soup
for you. Since you're here, you might as well eat.
...There's no sleeping drug in it, right?

There's none! One shouldn't doubt another's kindness, you
know?
Right. Sorry for doubting you... Then, I'll partake--

Uh-hum, this is truly a delicacy! The best thing about this
island is how delicious the fish are

It was delicious. The fish I caught myself somehow tastes
even better

Karin. Let's fulfill our promise. I'll share some valuable
information with you. Bring Kachou and Kisanosuke as well.
You want to help them escape the island too, don't you?
--! Understood. I'll bring them right away!
I've brought the two of them.
White-haired monk, you seem to be in good spirits again?

You did well to come. I'm grateful to you, Kachou, for
bringing me medicine when I had a stomachache.

Don't say that, Kisanosuke. You have my gratitude for
sharing your fish with me. You're smitten with Kachou,
aren't you?

It would be a shame for two young people to spend their
lives and die on this island. That's why I wanted to share
something with both of you today.

What are you talking about, Karin? This is all so sudden...
Can you explain it so we can understand?

...Well, this Kokuyou Tengu here has information on how to
escape the island...

Indeed. What I'm about to discuss should remain a secret
among the four of us. You must not tell any other exiles.
Understood?

I'm in. I always felt there was something mystical about
you. I won't tell anyone. I trust you. Let's hear it.

According to the head exile, there's a secret little port at
the northern tip of this island. And there's a boat there.

Yes. We four will steal that boat and set sail from the
island. We'll head north and make our way to Edo--that's my
plan for escaping this transient island.

...A boat? But I heard there was only a ferry on this
island?

That's just a front to prevent us exiles from escaping.
There has been a boat at the northern tip of the island
since old times. The head exile confirmed it himself.

Hmm. To get to the northern tip, we'll have to cross over
Tohru Pass first. We can't do that without defeating the
gate guards, can we?

No need to worry about that. I secretly checked at night,
and if it's late enough, the guards go home and aren't
around. We should be able to get through Tohru Pass to the
north without anyone noticing.

What do you say, everyone--will you join my plan? Or would
you rather stay on this desolate island for decades until
you die?
I understand. I will join your plan.

I don't mind either. I've grown tired of living here. If we
get caught, we're dead, but I still want to return to Edo.

...I am... honestly, scared... If the officials catch us,
escaping the island is a capital offense...

...(It's no wonder. It's a journey with no guarantee of
return...)
...Kachou-san. I just remembered... I once met your mother.

On the bridge in Fukagawa... she was always waiting for your
return. She said you stabbed a client at the brothel because
they did something unreasonable to you...

...There was a rough client who slapped the face of one of
my colleagues. I accidentally pointed my hairpin at him and
it stabbed into his chest... Since he was a samurai, I was
exiled to this island. That was two years ago...

I see... My mother is still waiting for me... Even though
she knows she'll never see me again because of my exile...
she's waiting...

Let's go, Kachou-san! If there's a boat, I can steer it!
This Kisanosuke used to be the best fisherman at steering
boats in Uraga! I'll definitely get us back to Edo! Right?!

And hey... if things go well... would you become my wife?
Please, it's my dying wish.

Good grief... Kisanosuke, aren't you getting a bit too
carried away?

Hehehe! Maybe I am! We've got to escape the island first...
Haha!

We all came to Mujou Island for different reasons, but our
desire to return home is the same. Let's leave this island.
And go see your mother. Right, Kachou-san?

Yes. I've made up my mind too. Even if we get caught, it
doesn't matter. Let's return to Edo. To our hometown--

Alright. It's decided then. The sooner we carry out our
plan, the better. Karin, go home today and speak to me when
you're ready to proceed. Understood?
Yeah. Got it! I'm counting on you, Kokuyou Tengu!
--Everyone went back to their homes to prepare.

You need four sea breams, right? I won't accept any other
fish. I'm looking forward to it.

Are you ready? Shall we proceed with the escape from the
island tonight?
Carry out the escape from the island
Hmm. Then, let's meet again at midnight...

--Karin returned to her hut and spent time there until
nightfall...
